descriptions.content:
This nominalizer shows the way in which the action designated by the verb is performed.

  • དེང་སང་བོད་ཀྱི་ཁང་པ་རྒྱག་སྟངས་སྔན་མ་དང་གཅིག་པ་མ་རེད། “The way they build houses in Tibet today is not as it was in the past.”
  • བུ་དང་བུ་མོའི་ཕྱུ་པ་གོན་སྟངས་ལོགས་ག་རེད། “The way men and women wear the chuba is different.”

The nominalizer may also be translated by a noun.

  • འཚོ་བ་སྐྱེལ་སྟངས་ “The lifestyle” (Literally: The way of leading one’s life)
  • གཏོར་མ་ཟོ་སྟངས་ “The production of tormas”

The verb to which the nominalizer སྟངས་ is suffixed goes in the present-future:

  • ལབ་སྟངས་ “Way of speaking”
  • འབྲི་སྟངས་ “Way of writing”
  • ཟ་སྟངས་ “Way of eating”
  • ལྟ་སྟངས་ “Way of looking,” “way of considering”

The following forms, in which the verb is in the past, are incorrect:

  • *བྲིས་སྟངས་
  • *བཟས་སྟངས་
  • *བལྟས་སྟངས་
